Sequence Information.Peptide Name: P5 (Lys-rich; Leu-rich; synthetic AMPs, UCLL1; XXA)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (60%) toC18GK: 50%; L: 39%.  GRAVY: -0.61; M Wt: 2246.995; Mol formula: C112H205N28O19; molar extinction coeff: 5550.Activity: active against Gram-  P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 3.13 uM), A. baumannii KCTC 2508 (MIC1.56 uM), Gram+ S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 1.56 uM), and B. subtilis KCTC 2217 (MIC 1.56 uM).Antimicrobial robustness:  NaCl-insensitive:P. aeruginosa (150 mM); NaCl-insensitive:S. aureus; MgCl2-insensitive:P. aeruginosa (150 mM); MgCl2-insensitive:S. aureus. FeCl3-insensitive:P. aeruginosa (150 mM); FeCl3-insensitive:S. aureus (8 uM).Structure: helical in 50% TFE. Provided by Arjun Nair.
Literature Information.Author: Kwon JY, Kim MK, Mereuta L, Seo CH, Luchian T, Park Y. 2019
Literature Information.Title: Mechanism of action of antimicrobial peptide P5 truncations against Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Staphylococcus aureus.
